results.title: Confusion: diagnosis and management
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
One in a series about techniques for the management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This episode looks in some detail, at the various causes of acute confusion, outlining the basic principles of treatment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films

results.title: Correcting
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program follows the trial of Nie Chengying, accused of stealing from her neighbour, to show the legal system at work in China. The legal system not only aims to punish and protect society, but also seeks to restore the social harmony which has been disturbed by the crime. Also explores the social pressures at work in the new consumer society which may cause a person to commit a crime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Trading
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Twelve of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Creating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program looks at the world of contemporary Chinese art, exploring the philosophic and historic influences that shape it. The way that Chinese artists pursue the essence of “reality” is examined as are the techniques which combine traditional values with unconventional materials to produce works that are resplendently Chinese.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Mediating
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is about the breakdown of a marriage and the pressures that are brought on the couple to reconcile their differences. Highlights that, in China, society comes before the individual and the family must be maintained, whatever the cost.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton

results.title: Your body during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”.
Eighteen young people from thirteen to fifteen are shown to vary widely in size and shape, although all are changing from childhood to adulthood. The film mentions the general functions of the endocrine glands and the influence of the pituitary glands on growth changes, which may normally occur in any order. The structure and functioning of the male and female reproductive organs are outlined.
results.description:

group_siblings.title: Community health and you

results.title: Living
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
Over four fifths of China’s 1000 million inhabitants are peasants. This program visits a rural village to discover how they live. We follow the day to day life of a village family and focuses on the local Party secretary to depict the organisation of the village as a whole and the brigade and commune of which it is a part.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mischa Scorer, Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
